comments:
Hi, 
I have CVS version
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.12.8 (client/server)

installed on a linux server.

I am using eclipse in a win2k workstation.

When I checkout from this server or commit small files everything is fine. 

However when I modify a big java file(220k) and commit back, 
there is a problem. (There are hundreds of versions of this file).

The eclipse stuck there and the progress bar shows sending file 64k of 220k
and popup a error message says "Timeout while writing to output stream"

the CSV console log looks as follows
***
cvs ci -m -l "xxxx.java"
failed due to an internal error (took 1:01.128)
   Error: Timeout while writing to output stream
***

The exception stacktrace as follows
java.io.InterruptedIOException: Timeout while writing to output stream
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.streams.PollingOutputStream.write(PollingOutputStream.java:99)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.sendUncompressedBytes(Session.java:718)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.sendFile(Session.java:658)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.sendModified(Session.java:598)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.AbstractStructureVisitor.sendFile(AbstractStructureVisitor.java:201)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.ModifiedFileSender.sendFile(ModifiedFileSender.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.FileStructureVisitor.visitFile(FileStructureVisitor.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseFile.accept(EclipseFile.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.AbstractStructureVisitor.visit(AbstractStructureVisitor.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Commit.sendLocalResourceState(Commit.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.doExecute(Command.java:394)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command$1.run(Command.java:326)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseSynchronizer.run(EclipseSynchronizer.java:1456)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseResource$2.run(EclipseResource.java:260)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseResource.run(EclipseResource.java:257)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.execute(Command.java:338)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.execute(Command.java:798)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.CommitOperation.executeCommand(CommitOperation.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.SingleCommandOperation.execute(SingleCommandOperation.java:42)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:282)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.SingleCommandOperation.execute(SingleCommandOperation.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:256)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:210)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.CVSOperation.run(CVSOperation.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.wizards.CommitWizard$AddAndCommitOperation.execute(CommitWizard.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.CVSOperation.run(CVSOperation.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext.run(JobRunnableContext.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext$ResourceJob.runInWorkspace(JobRunnableContext.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)









Could this because that there are too many versions so that CVS server cannot handle it or the filesize too big to be sent?

Note that some library file with even bigger size can commit.
It is odd that you are gettign a timeout on a send. One thing you could try is to increase the CVS timeout. You can do this on the Connection tab of the Team>CVS preference page.
Moving to REMIND awaiting a response. Please reopen with the requested information (i.e. did increasing the timeout help?)

Hi Micheal,

Increasing the timeout did not help. However, now I upgraded my OS from win 2k to win XP and the problem went away. I can update/commit smoothly now. One of my server using win 2k server version also have similar problem using WINCVS, therefore I suspect its the server side problem but not Eclipse's.

Since this problem is not bugging me anymore, can we close it?

Thanks a lot!

Regards
Shilin

traces.message: Timeout while writing to output stream
